Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feedback] VS2017 enterprise check Budle Assemblies into Native Code, Localization not work" (#2178) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @samhouts on September 5, 2018 19:8_ ### Reproduction [TodoLocalized.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2372808/TodoLocalized.zip) If you set the Android project configuration to Release Mode and check "Bundle assemblies into native code" then localization doesn't work if you uncheck "Bundle assemblies into native code" then localization works 1) on the first page there's a picker at the top you can click to select different languages 2) select a different language 3) click on the PLUS arrow to go to the second page 4) the text on the buttons should now be in the language you selected This has come up before https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43787461/localization-doesnt-work-using-bundle-assemblies-into-native-code-in-release https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=55603 ### Description From Dev Community

xamarin.forms , Currently when build release Xamarin Android Apk then install app on device,it is run well ,but Localization is not work, it is only show system language(chinese) and english,when I change language to Korean ,it is show english not Korean . when i not check Budle Assemblies into Native Code,it is run well for Localization . project See Attachment Steps: 1.select release mode,check Budle Assemblies into Native Code ,then generate project 2.Archive the project and distribute 3.Install app on device,then open app, change language hope get help,thanks!

View on Developer Community
To find diagnostic information, see the original linked feedback ticket. ### Source [661459](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/661459) _Copied from original issue: xamarin/Xamarin.Forms#3718_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS 2017 15.9.2 axml code broken" (#2455) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a pre-created file
2. Try to add a new property for any element (android:id for example)

### Expected Behavior
The editor continue working and I can type the value for property
### Actual Behavior
VS crashes without any sign of log file and reopens sometimes
### Version Information
15.9.2

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[C] fallback nicely in case of IndexOutOfRangeEx" (#4525) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This PR does 3 things:
- In case of Binding path with indexer, lookout for
  IndexOutOfRangeException in addition to KeyNotFoundException.
- in case of KeyNotFound or IndexOutOfRange, use the FallbackValue if
  any.
- in case of an uncaught exception, throw that exception instead of a
  TargetInvocationException.

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes #4516

### API Changes ###

Added:

 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 Removed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 -->
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
